message.content:
cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.RO, cs.LO, cs.PL

The paper discusses the development and verification of hybrid systems, which are cyber-physical systems with both discrete and continuous dynamics. This topic is most closely related to the sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY), which deals with the modeling, analysis, and control of complex systems. The paper also mentions the use of model-driven engineering and formal verification, which are techniques commonly used in Software Engineering (cs.SE) to ensure the correctness of software systems. Additionally, the paper mentions expertise from domains such as robotics (cs.RO), logic (cs.LO), and programming languages (cs.PL), indicating that the development and verification of hybrid systems requires knowledge from multiple areas of computer science. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.RO, cs.LO, and cs.PL, in that order.
